column4: Where can i set which kernel is booted? I just installed one, but it isn't used...
if you installed through synaptic you need to reboot
used terminal and rebooted... both 2 times...
what's the output of:  uname -ar   ?
Linux nicofs-netbook 2.6.32-23-generic #37-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jun 11 07:54:58 UTC 2010 i686 GNU/Linux
is that the old kernel showing up?
that's not the one i installed... i guess it's the old one... i didn't check what the old one was...
you could black list wmi
how do i do that?
what do you get in terminal with:  lsmod | grep acer-wmi
nothing
then you could try blacklisting it
and how do i do that?
do this:  sudo updatedb && locate blacklist.conf
done. and now?
did it tell you where's the blacklist.conf file?
yes. open it in editor?
yes gksu gedit
i assume something like "blacklist acer-wmi" ?
correct, add that line, save it and restart the pc, check if you get the error
apparently it worked. Thanks for that.
yw
